titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Finding aid prepared by Brian Carpenter

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T21:12-0400

did.unittitle: Interviews on Cheyenne, Comanche, Kiowa, and Apache military societies
did.abstract: Audio recordings of interviews with Cheyenne, Comanche, Kiowa, and Kiowa Apache consultants regarding military societies, related dances and ceremonial traditions, the participation of Indians veterans in the U.S. military during wars in the 20th century--including Comanche code talkers--and related topics. Also includes recordings of performances by the Comanche Tuhwi Society, Kiowa Black Legs Society, Kiowa Scalp & Victory Dance Songs, Kiowa children's songs, and some Kiowa folklore. Recorded by William C. Meadows in various locations in Oklahoma in 1992 and 1993.
did.physdesc: 13 sound cassettes (16 hr., 32 min.) : analog, 1 7/8 ips, stereo.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Presented by William Meadows in 1994 (Acc. 1994-127r). This material was recorded with the assistance of a Phillips Fund grant.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Extensive notes on taped interviews and related, untaped interviews are available in the Phillips Fund Collection (Mss.497.3.Am4).
